The Art and Science of Uncertainty and the Future

An Interdisciplinary Summer School

06-11 July 2026
|
Cardiff, Wales, UK
|
Contact Us
Apply Now - Deadline: 1 March 2026

Engage with Uncertainty. Shape the Future.

This summer school provides a unique opportunity to develop skills, strengthen networks, and advance creative and interdisciplinary research on uncertainty and the future.

Build Futures Capacity

Develop the knowledge, confidence, and collaborative mindset needed to navigate uncertainty and imagine alternative futures.

Connect Ideas and Disciplines

Join a diverse international community to share knowledge, connect perspectives, and co-create new collaborations across disciplines and sectors.

Advance Futures Research and Practice

Collaborate across disciplines to explore complex challenges and generate ideas that inform the creation of liveable futures.

Imagine Liveable Futures

Explore new ways of thinking and creating to envision more sustainable and inclusive futures.

Important Dates

26 November 2025 Application open
01 March 2026 Application close

05 July 2026 Welcome reception drink
06–10 July 2026 Summer school
11 July 2026 Site visit

Partners & Supporters

This event is organised by the Data Lab for Social Good at Cardiff Business School, with support and sponsorship from a network of academic and civic partners.

Organisational Support

Sponsors

Ready to Shape the Future?

Applications for our 2026 Summer School are now open. Join a diverse cohort of 40 participants in Cardiff for an intensive week of collaboration, learning, and creative exploration.

Apply Now

The summer school is aimed at PhD students, postdoctoral researchers, and early-career academics and practitioners from across disciplines.

Questions? Please contact halgamuwehewagehr@cardiff.ac.uk.

Hosted by the Data Lab for Social Good Research Group, Cardiff Business School and the Uncertainty and Future Theme, Digital Transformation and Innovation Institute (DTII).
